labels.analysis: The MCP Server specializes in providing location-based services through AMap integration. The primary tool, query_weather, allows users to access weather data based on geographic information, which is a key component of location services. This server enables applications to integrate geographic data seamlessly, addressing use cases related to weather forecasting, geographic queries, and location-based operations.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of this server revolves around geographic and location services, making "Travel & Maps" the most appropriate predefined category. While weather data access is available, it is secondary to the broader context of location services. No predefined category properly describes the unique integration with AMap for MCP clients, so a custom label is included to highlight this.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: AMap Location Service Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Francis235/amap-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable your applications to interact with powerful location-based services from AMap through a standardized protocol. Query location data seamlessly within MCP clients like Cursor, Claude Desktop, and others. Simplify integration of geographic information into your workflows with this server.

tools.name: query_weather
tools.description: Deploy Server AMap Location Service Server Claim Server @Francis235/amap-mcp Try in Playground query_weather

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Francis235/amap-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
